Steps.Message: We became aware of a power cut at 09:40. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly.
Steps.Name: Power cut reported

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Engineers investigating and fixing

Steps.Message: All power in the area should be back on. We’re really sorry for any disruption this caused.
Steps.Name: Power restored

UKPNIncident.PlannedIncidentReason: Our contractors Avidety Ltd are replacing electricity poles to raise the current height of our overhead electricity cables to ensure they meet safety requirements. This will improve the reliability of our electricity network and will reduce the risk of an unplanned power cut. This is why it is important to complete the work during the Coronavirus pandemic. You may see our contractors erecting the new poles prior to the outage to allow for a shorter interruption. Due to safety reasons our contractors need to complete a safety check with your internal equipment checking a plug and a socket on separate circuits to enable the power to be turned on and off. Due to these checks being manual we aim to turn the power off at 09:30 and back on at 15:30, however the checks may take longer so please allow extra time for the checks to be completed. Access will only be required before and after the power cut. This work is taking place outside Thistle and Kingsgate View, Winser Road, Cranbrook.
